title: High Flow/High Velocity Oxygen therapy compentency document
description: A competency document to be used and adapted by educators to assess competency in High flow and High Velocity Oxygen therapy.

title: Vapotherm: a guide to setting up the machine
description: A video that demonstrates how to put together the device, prepare the infant and initiate therapy.

title: How to Set Up Airvo
description: This 4 minute video highlights required consumables and demonstrates setup of the Airvo humidified high flow system. It includes a walk-through of the machine control panel to provide a quick summary of initial setup considerations and how to change between paediatric and adult modes.

title: Vapotherm Teaching Presentation
description: A presentation focussed on teaching users about the principles behind vapotherm and how to use it

title: Oxygen Therapy Competency Document
description: A competency document for administration of oxygen

title: Overview of Bronchiolitis for Families and Carers
description: This NHS webpage provides professional advice for families and carers of children who may have bronchiolitis. It includes an overview of causes, symptoms, diagnosis, treatment, complications and prevention. It also explains when to seek medical help if you think a child in your care is unwell.
domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: Re-ACT Talks: Deterioration: How to Spot the Sick Child
description: This NHS England video provides guidance about the presentation and identifying features of seriously ill children, presented by an Emergency Medicine consultant. This includes risk stratification, clarifying points for history taking, and examination. It also briefly discusses presentations with fever and signposts to additional resources.
domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title: Optiflow Cannula Fitting Guide
Recognition of the Sick Child: Paediatric Emergencies 2020
description: This video lecture mainly focuses on previously well children who present with an illness involving fever. It guides the viewer through risk stratification, history, observation and observations, examination, and red flags. It is presented by a Paediatric Emergency Department Consultant and is aimed at any healthcare professional (pre-hospital to emergency hospital setting) who works with acutely unwell children.
domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title: Fundamentals of Bronchiolitis presentation and management
description: This webpage provides videos, podcast and written information on the physiology and management of bronchiolitis of the child for those gaining initial knowledge in a healthcare setting
domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: Demonstration of a paediatric clinical examination - The respiratory system
description: This video demonstrates how to undertake a respiratory clinical assessment of a child. Including communication with a child and family.
domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title: Demonstration of a respiratory assessment from MRCPCH
description: These videos facilitate clinical revision of respiratory assessment, respiratory distress and chest examination on a child and infant. With communication with the carer and child.
domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title: Lung Sounds
description: A video describing auscultation and the physiology behind lung sounds commonly heard during inhalation and exhalation including stridor, wheeze, plural rub, crackles, rhonchi
domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: Bronchiolitis
description: The session covers bronchiolitis, including its aetiology, natural history, clinical features and treatment
domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: Neonatal inspection and examination
description: This e-learning session describes a comprehensive approach to the clinical assessment of a neonatal patient with a respiratory problem. It details what to include in a respiratory inspection and physical examination.
domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: Paediatric Emergency Drug Chart (2021) (RCUK)
description: This is a PDF of paediatric emergency drug doses and medications set out in a standard format for use in any centre as guidance from the Resus Council (UK, 2021)
domain: 4. Differences between child and adult and Medicines Management

title: How to set up Optiflow
description: This 4 minute video produced by a paediatric nursing education team highlights required consumables and demonstrates setup of the Optiflow humidified high flow system. It includes a walk-through of the machine control panel to provide a quick summary of initial setup considerations and how to change between paediatric and adult modes.

title: The (Primary Care) Decision Maker’s Guide to Bronchiolitis Assessment
description:
This primary care blog post shares with the reader three key stages in assessing the child who may have bronchiolitis, illustrated by clear decision making diagrams: 
Qu.1 Does this child have bronchiolitis? 
Qu.2 Should this child be managed at home or in hospital? 
Qu.3 What treatment should the child be given?
domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title: Leadership in Paediatric Emergency
description: A podcast discussing leadership in paediatric emergencies and the impact of human factors
domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title: Recognition of the Sick Child
description: A podcast discussing the recognition of the sick child in the emergency department
domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title: An Infant with Problematic Bronchiolitis - Paediatric Emergencies 2020
domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title: Recognition and Initial Management of the Deteriorating Child (RCUK)
description:
This PowerPoint presentation provided by Resus Council UK (2021) introduces the importance of and techniques for performing a structured ABCDE approach to rapidly identify seriously ill children. It supports understanding that there is often some respiratory compensation for circulatory failure and vice versa​ in sick children. Paediatric Early Warning Score (PEWS) and the SBAR handover tool is introduced. The resource is underpinned by RCUK 2021 guidelines.

​
domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title:
Every Action Counts:
Supporting excellence in infection prevention and control (IPC) behaviours
description:
This NHS web page has links to various IPC documents including:
- An implementation toolkit that is designed as a one-stop-shop to provide information, resources, and ideas to local NHS organisations to address the barriers to behavioural compliance with IPC measures. This includes resources and tools targeting compliance and awareness, leadership, morale and wellbeing, training, and operational interventions.

mapped_skills.objective: Safety >  Standard and Transmission Based Infection Control Precautions (ICP) > Understands the ten Standard ICP measures to reduce risk of transmissions of infectious agents, including how to preform patient placement risk assessments e.g. cohorting and understanding local environment

title: NHS Scotland.  National Infection Prevention and Control Manual (NIPCM)
description: This links to the NHS Scotland National Infection Prevention & Control manual, which is a comprehensive resource for staff  working across all levels of care in Scotland.

title: RCUK Baby with increased work of breathing
description: This very short video shows an infant with increased work of breathing using all their accessory muscles
domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title: RCPCH guidance
description: This RCPCH infographic provides a one-page summary of 2021 key guidance for those caring for children with possible bronchiolitis or lower respiratory tract infections. It includes a quick overview of pre-hospital care, diagnostic testing requirements, cohorting, PPE, and effects related to regional prevalence.

title: Educational Videos from the North Thames Childrens Acute Transport Service (CATS)
description: CATS Website containing educational videos on Bronchiolitis, Breathlessness and different ventilators (among other videos)

mapped_skills.objective:
Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Management and 
Escalation > Awareness of the regional Paediatric Critical Care Transport Teams across the UK

title: RCPCH Managing RSV & other respiratory viruses in 2021
description:
A webinar hosted by RCPCH with multiple elements - time stamps in brackets to aid rapid navigation
1. Welcome (0:00)
2. Signals from Health Surveillance, Senior Medical Advisor Public Health England (02:05 - 17:30)
3. National Response to planning for rise in RSV, National Speciality Advisor to CYP at NHS England (No slides, 17:30 - 19:10)
3. Infection Prevention and Control, IPC Lead NHS England (24:10 - 34.22)
4. Urgent and Emergency Care Perspectives, Paediatric Emergency Medicine Consultant (37:32 - 50:52)
5. Clinical Management and Discharge, Paediatric Respiratory Consultant (52:17 - 1:03:27)

title: Example Clinical Guidelines for transfer of child with bronchiolitis
description:
This short overview PDF contains information on 1. Diagnosis, 2. Initial Management, 3. Respiratory Support 4. Management following intubation & 5. Transport considerations. 
(This is an example from one acute transfer service (CATS) and you must check your local transfer service for their specific guidance.)

title: Paediatric Critical Care - Severe Bronchiolitis
description:
This 1 page summary sheet provides guidance for those patients with severe bronchiolitis who are being considered for critical care, thus interventions like chest x-ray(CXR), bloods, fluid restriction and antibiotics are appropriate. 
(This is an example from one acute transfer service (STRS) and you must check your local transfer service for their specific guidance.)

mapped_skills.objective: Airway >  Endotracheal tube care (Intubated Patient) > Explains how to recognise deterioration in an intubated patient

title: Pre-transport stabilisation
description:
This 1-page guideline is for staff to use as a prompt when preparing a child for safe retrieval.
(This is an example from one acute transfer service (STRS) and you must check your local transfer service for their specific guidance.)

mapped_skills.objective:
Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Management and 
Escalation > Able to prepare a child requiring transfer to another unit for esculation of treatments e.g. for the transport team to retreive from a DGH and transfer to a PICU

title: Difficulty breathing and wheeze: Guidance for carers of children aged 3 months and older
description: This Healthier Together / NHS webpage provides guidance for parents and carers for children aged 3 months and older who are concerned that their child is having difficulty breathing. It offers advice on 'when to worry', what to do, how long symptoms might last and where to seek help.

title: Looking after a ventilated child on Adult ICU
description:
This 1-page guideline is for the use of when caring for children ventilated in adult ITU.  It discusses ventilation, cardiovascular considerations, antibiotic and line insertion as well as analgesia and feeding.
(This is an example from one acute transfer service (STRS) and you must check your local transfer service for their specific guidance and drug calculators .)

title: Bronchiolitis Pathway - Primary and community care. Healthier Together / NHS
description: This Healthier Together / NHS one-page PDF provides an overarching clinical assessment and management tool for children younger than 1 with suspected bronchiolitis for primary care and community settings

mapped_skills.objective:
Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Management and 
Escalation > Understands how and when to escalate and how and when to refer child to next level of care and co-ordinates care with other healthcare professionals

domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: Getting it right for Children and Young People, RCN
description: This toolkit developed by the RCN will support registered nurses working out of hospital settings in providing care to children and young people.

title: RCPCH Paediatric Prescribing Principles (online learning)
description: This eLearning module (updated 2016) is for all paediatricians, from trainee to consultant, and any health professionals with a role in prescribing medication to children and young people. It includes childhood physiological changes and impact on metabolism, explanation of adverse drug reactions, and safe prescribing and administration principles. It also explores why errors may occur, and methods to improve patient safety.

mapped_skills.objective: Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Assessment and Recognition > Adopts an A-E approach to assessing a sick and deterioriating child

domain: 4. Differences between child and adult and Medicines Management

title: Medicines for Children: Information for parents and carers
description: This website offered practical and reliable advice about giving medicine to your child. E.g. paracetamol or salbutamol

title: Bronchiolitis, escalation to transfer and PICU care, Children Acute Transport System (CATS)
description:
This webinar was delivered in response to the predicted surge in children unwell with respiratory disease. It is delivered by a transfer service (CATS) but the messages are applicable across the country. Please use the timings given below to navigate to the sections most pertinent to your practice.
1. Introduction and the size of the problem (0:00 - 8:20
2. Presentations of 'bronchiolitis' and important differential diagnoses (08:25 - 26:10)
3. Evidence for treating bronchiolitis (26:40 - 46:00)
4. Which children with bronchiolitis need referring for transfer? (46:23 - 1:02:30)
5. Intubating bronchiolitis (1:17:55 - 1:47:47)
6. Summary of PICU care of bronchiolitis (1:48:16 - 1:56:10)
7. Teenage presentations that may need to stay in AICU (1:56:30 - 2:02:30)

mapped_skills.objective: Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Assessment and Recognition > B - Discuss underlying causes for apnoea's and investigations required
Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Assessment and Recognition > Can determine severity of child's condition (Bronchiolitis), including recognising concerning symptoms

Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Management and 
Escalation > Understands how and when to escalate and how and when to refer child to next level of care and co-ordinates care with other healthcare professionals

title: Intensive Care Society and Paediatric Critical Care Society joint statement on RSV, June 2021
description: This statement lays out the mutual aid position of the adult intensive care and paediatric intensive care societies in the UK.

title: Bronchiolitis - More than just a snuffly nose?
description: This webinar covers the pathophysiology, presentation and diagnosis of bronchiolitis, including x-ray findings and investigations. It also includes risk factors for development of serious illness and evaluation of the effectiveness of specific interventions.

mapped_skills.objective: Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Assessment and Recognition > Can describe signs and symptoms of Bronchiolitis; recognises presentation
Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Assessment and Recognition > Can describe high risk groups for poorer prognosis (Bronchiolitis)
Breathing >  Respiratory physiology > Demonstrates how to interpret a chest x-ray and how the finidings affect the clinical decision making

Breathing >  Respiratory physiology > Describe the basic anatomy and physiology involved in respiration appropriate for level of care/intervention required (inc. components of the respiratory system for level of care e.g. oxygenation, gas exchange, V/Q mismatch)

domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: LTV Resource Hub Quick Guide to User guides, circuit set up and education resources
description: A poster of QR codes directing the user to LTV user guides, circuit set up and education resources

mapped_skills.objective: Breathing >  Long term ventilation / LTV > Demonstrates how to set up an LTV circuit and how to troubleshoot

domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title: Top tips for managing the deteriorating patient whilst awaiting the retrieval service
description: A webinar that discusses the medical and nursing management of a child who is deteriorating and requires level 3 care in the DGH setting, what to think about, and how to manage the patient whilst awaiting retrieval.

mapped_skills.objective: Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Assessment and Recognition > Adopts an A-E approach to assessing a sick and deterioriating child

Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Emergency Advanced stabilisation including intubation and ventilation > Can set up a clinical space for advanced stabilsation and monitoring

title: Bronchiolitis case presentation: progressing through level 1, level 2 and level 3 care.
description:
This presentation walks the viewer through the case of a 17/40 ex-prem baby presenting with cough and coryza. It discusses the escalation of care required from presentation to hospital to  level 3 care. 
00:00 - Intro and initial clinical presentation to hospital
05:20 - Level 1 / Ward admission
08:50 - Level 2 / Admission to HDU 
16:15 - Deterioration and Escalation
22:43 - L3 / ICU care
28:20 - ECMO
34:10 - Outcome of pts with co-morbidities
36:33 - RSV prophylaxis.

mapped_skills.objective: Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Assessment and Recognition > Adopts an A-E approach to assessing a sick and deterioriating child

keywords: heated humidified high flow oxygen therapy
domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title: Principles of infant CPAP
description:
A webinar that explores the use of infant CPAP for respiratory support, considers the evidence to support the therapy and discusses the nursing care of a child on infant CPAP.                 
0.00  - 07.15 Introduction                                                               
7.15 - 15.25 case presentation and discussion                          
15.25 - 30.50 Benefits of CPAP - the evidence                           
31.30 - 46.06 Nursing care of a child on CPAP, set up of SiPAP  
46.06 sign posting to further resources.

mapped_skills.objective: Breathing >  Non-invasive ventilation (CPAP, BiPAP) > Can explain the difference between NIV and CPAP, including indications, contraindications and mechanism of action
Breathing >  Non-invasive ventilation (CPAP, BiPAP) > Explains how to escalate early if a patient on NIV (e.g. increasing oxygen requirement / increased respiratory effort)

domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: Medication worksheet for Adult Critical Care nurses caring for children
description: This worksheet was created for adult critical care nurses who may care for children requiring level 2 or level 3 care in a district general hospital. It includes some general principles about medication calculations which differ between children and adults and four examples of calculations which need to be performed. The worksheet is replicated with the answers included (in red) on the last two pages.
domain: 4. Differences between child and adult and Medicines Management

title:
Royal College of Paediatrics and Child Health (RCPCH) - National guidance for the
management of children with
bronchiolitis and lower respiratory
tract infections during COVID-19
description:
These recommendations on the management of children with bronchiolitis and
lower respiratory tract infections in hospital settings during COVID-19 are for
clinicians to support winter planning in partnership with local infection control
prevention teams.
While some recommendations describe organisational structures in England,
services in the devolved nations are encouraged to adopt them to fit local models.

mapped_skills.objective: Safety >  Standard and Transmission Based Infection Control Precautions (ICP) > Understands RSV routes of transmission
Breathing >  High flow therapy > Demonstrates the need for high flow therapy and the benefits of high flow/ high velocity therapy

title: What is the evidence for high flow in bronchiolitis? (DFTB)
description: Review and critical analysis of a recent systematic review of the evidence for use of high flow oxygen therapy in infants with bronchiolitis in the Emergency Department (PREDICT, July 2019). The post describes the findings of RCTs on the topic, safety of high flow and authors' recommendations on when to start high flow in infants with bronchiolitis.

title: High flow therapy - when and how? (DFTB)
description: Review and critical analysis of systematic reviews evaluating high flow oxygen therapy as a first line method for oxygen delivery in differing severities of bronchiolitis. This post also explains how to commence, escalate and wean patients on high flow oxygen therapy.

mapped_skills.objective: Breathing >  High flow therapy > Demonstrates the need for high flow therapy and the benefits of high flow/ high velocity therapy

title: The effect of oximetry on hospital admission for bronchiolitis (DFTB)
description: Review and critical analysis of a double blinded randomised control trial evaluating the impact of pulse oximetry readings on hospitalisation rates for bronchiolitis. This post demonstrates the importance of our clinical evaluation versus reliance on cut off values for oximetry when deciding if hospitalisation is warranted.

mapped_skills.objective: Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Taking and recording of vital signs > Demonstrate how to interpret observations (vital signs) as appropriate for level of care/setting
Breathing >  Oxygen therapy and Pulse Oximetry > Demonstrates awareness of limitations of SpO2 monitoring

domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: Bronchiolitis guidelines (DFTB)
description: Summary of the Australasian PREDICT network guidelines on managing bronchiolitis in a hospital setting. This includes 22 key recommendations on investigations and treatment strategies.
domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: Through the looking glass (DFTB)
description: Evaluation of a systematic review and meta-analysis on the clinical indicators to suggest ordering a chest x-ray in patients with suspected bronchiolitis to evaluate for alternative diagnoses. This review suggests that chest x-rays should not be ordered on children with clinically obvious bronchiolitis, in line with the ALARA (as low as reasonably achievable) principle of radioprotection.
domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: Following bronchiolitis guidelines (DFTB)
description: Review and critical analysis of a multi-centre cluster randomised control trial evaluating the effectiveness of targeted interventions and resources to reduce clinician utilisation of low-value therapies in the management of bronchiolitis. Adoption of targeted interventions led to a significant difference in the compliance rate to the Australasian PREDICT bronchiolitis recommendations, thus reducing the amount of unnecessary interventions and overall improving patient-centred care.
domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: Rapid sequence induction and the difficult airway module: severe respiratory distress (advanced case + discussion) (DFTB)
description: Education module presenting a case of severe respiratory distress requiring RSI (rapid sequence induction) for intubation. Participants are prompted to answer questions around atropine preloading, use of uncuffed vs cuffed endotracheal tubes, and use of bougies.

title: Bronchiolitis module (DFTB)
description: Education module based on the clinical management of bronchiolitis. Participants will complete case discussions on treatment options, escalation of care, nutrition and intubation, differential diagnoses and complete a simulation and final quiz.

mapped_skills.objective: Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Assessment and Recognition > Can determine severity of child's condition (Bronchiolitis), including recognising concerning symptoms

Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Management and 
Escalation > Understands how and when to escalate and how and when to refer child to next level of care and co-ordinates care with other healthcare professionals

Breathing >  High flow therapy > Demonstrates how to set up and use the high flow/high velocity circuit, including troubleshooting. Is able to provide continued care and can demonstrate when to wean and how to recongise the deterioriating patient on high flow/ high velocity therapy.

domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: 10 Thinks: A Message From Parents (DFTB)
description: Infographic outlining ten key messages from parents and caregivers to their child's treating team. The post highlights the importance of maintaining a strong parent-clinician relationship and including family in all aspects of patient care.

mapped_skills.objective: Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Assessment and Recognition > E - Assesses and understands importance of family/clinican concern and actively explores/responds

title: The Smile Behind The Mask (DFTB)
description: A blog post reminding us of the importance of maintaining a connection with our patients and their families, especially when our personal protective equipment may be hiding our faces. The post encourages you to put yourself in a child's shoes to see the healthcare setting from their perspective. It provides some practical tips on how we can convey tenderness and warmth and show our smiles behind the masks.

title: Jesse Spurr: Safe Debriefing at DFTB17 (DFTB)
description: Jesse Spurr's presentation at the DFTB17 conference delves into the challenges of debriefing in the clinical setting. Spurr dissects two key papers from the debriefing literature which explore the importance of psychological safety, multiple debriefing methods and how to translate these approaches from simulation to real life practice.

title: The High Yield Respiratory Examination: David Krieser at DFTB19 (DFTB)
description: David Krieser presented at the DFTB19 conference on the respiratory examination and assessment. His talk emphasises the high yield components of the examination 'bento box' with a prioritisation of airway and breathing reminding us all to 'look, listen and feel'. Viewers are invited to test their recognition of signs of deterioration in the respiratory patient with three case studies.

mapped_skills.objective: Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Assessment and Recognition > Appropriately selective in the choice of enquiries, examinations and investigations for respriatory illness in children
Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Assessment and Recognition > A - Recognise partially obstructed and obstructed airway and take appropriate action
Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Assessment and Recognition > Can determine severity of child's condition (Bronchiolitis), including recognising concerning symptoms

domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title: The Paediatric Assessment Triangle (DFTB)
description: On overview of a well-known  evaluation tool for differentiating the sick child from the well child based on initial clinical assessment. It delves into the three aspects of the Paediatric Assessment Triangle: appearance, breathing and circulation and analyses its efficacy at identifying unstable patients by various cohorts of medical practitioners.

mapped_skills.objective: Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Assessment and Recognition > Adopts an A-E approach to assessing a sick and deterioriating child

domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title: Can't Intubate, Can't Oxygenate (DFTB)
description: An outline of what to do in the daunting 'can't intubate, can't oxygenate' (CICO) scenario. This post compares the assessment of a difficult airway and airway management techniques used in children with those traditionally applied to the adult.
domain: 4. Differences between child and adult and Medicines Management

title: Covid and RSV (DFTB)
description: Following a look at Australasian data on the 'out of season RSV' surge following relaxation of lockdown measures; this post outlines current RCPCH guidance on patient flow strategies for children presenting with cough and fever, including pathways and guidance for testing and cohorting.  It looks at ways in which we can safely manage children with respiratory illness in the community with the aim of reducing hospital attendances with mild cases; and how patient time on High flow and reducing the exposures to aerosol generated pathogens can be minimised.

mapped_skills.objective: Safety >  Standard and Transmission Based Infection Control Precautions (ICP) > Understands the ten Standard ICP measures to reduce risk of transmissions of infectious agents, including how to preform patient placement risk assessments e.g. cohorting and understanding local environment

domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: Prepare For Transport: Costas Kanaris at DFTB19 (DFTB)
description: An overview of the systematic A-E approach to stabilising a sick child for transport; includes rationale behind considerations such as choice of induction agents, vasoactive agents; fluids and antimicrobials. Stresses importance of teamwork and communication to achieve best possible patient outcome.

mapped_skills.objective:
Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Management and 
Escalation > Able to prepare a child requiring transfer to another unit for esculation of treatments e.g. for the transport team to retreive from a DGH and transfer to a PICU

keywords: evaluation of the sick child or infant

title: Lockie: KIDS – Just Little Adults? (ICN)
description: A podcast with accompanying slides providing guidance on the timely recognition and management of the sick/critically unwell child; why physiological differences between adults and children demand certain/nuanced practices in their stabilisation; and key differential diagnosis to consider that may masquerade as respiratory disease.

mapped_skills.objective: Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Assessment and Recognition > Appropriately selective in the choice of enquiries, examinations and investigations for respriatory illness in children
Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Assessment and Recognition > Adopts an A-E approach to assessing a sick and deterioriating child
Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Assessment and Recognition > Can determine severity of child's condition (Bronchiolitis), including recognising concerning symptoms

keywords: evaluation of sick child or infant
domain: 4. Differences between child and adult and Medicines Management

title: Emotional contagion (DFTB)
description: This talk discusses how our emotions and behaviours at work affect those around us. As we experience even higher pressure during surge times we need to bear in mind how we can improve the work place for everyone.

title: Intraosseous access (DFTB)
description: A comprehensive overview of intraosseous access through discussion of a case study; including indications, contraindications, technique, sites, landmarks, considerations in an alert child, complications and equipment.

mapped_skills.objective: Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Emergency Advanced stabilisation including intubation and ventilation > Demonstrates awareness of when IO access should be sought

keywords: evaluation of sick child or infant

title: DFTB in EMA2- Identifying the sick febrile child (DFTB)
description: An analysis of the clinical tools we can use to identify the 'needle in the haystack'-the sick febrile child. Including history, physical examination, physiological markers, and parental gestalt.
keywords: evaluation of sick child or infant
domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title: Managing Bronchiolitis in a busy Emergency Department (DFTB)
description: This infographic from DFTB on managing a busy ED full of children with respiratory disease, offers quick reminders of key areas to tackle: Inflow, acuity, outflow and crowding.

mapped_skills.objective: Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Assessment and Recognition > Can describe high risk groups for poorer prognosis (Bronchiolitis)

title: Outflow Block: Managing the Emergency Department in a Respiratory Surge (DFTB)
description:
With the upcoming predicted respiratory surge, it is likely that we will find our EDs full, potentially also with a full hospital and PICU. It’s therefore important to start planning for the consequences of this now. This video from DFTB is important for those working in all parts of the patient pathway to watch and concentrates on 3 key areas: 
- Departmental Flow
- Staff Wellbeing and Morale
- Diagnostic and in-patient dilemmas (i.e. RSV vs Covid)

title: Managing a Busy Emergency Department (DFTB)
description:
With the upcoming predicted respiratory surge, it is likely that we will find our EDs full, potentially also with a full hospital and PICU. It’s therefore important to start planning for the consequences of this now. This blog from DFTB concentrates on 3 key areas:
- Departmental Flow
- Staff Wellbeing and Morale
- Diagnostic and in-patient dilemmas (i.e. RSV vs Covid)

title: Pharmacy and drug prescription in children being managed on adult ICUs
description:
Guidance for those prescribing drugs for children in an ICU context, presented by  PICU consultant Pam D'Silva
1:10 Resources
2:23 Paediatric Drug Prescriptions
4:00 Standard Names and Units
5:10 Examples of age, weight and dose
8:25 Antimicrobial Guide
8:50 Maintenance Fluids
14:32 Loses and Replacement
15:28 Electrolyte correction
16:40 Drug Infusions
17:58 Blood Products and transfusion
19:45 Sedated and ventilated children
21:15 Online Guidelines
21:35 Sedation for intubated and ventilated children
domain: 4. Differences between child and adult and Medicines Management

title: Physiotherapy aspects of managing children on adult ICUs
description: Presentation with an overview of difference between adults and children; when to do physiotherapy treatments and what treatments to consider

mapped_skills.objective: Breathing >  Additional therapy > Describe the process of referral to appropriate therapist and assist with suggested therapy to improve patient respiratory status

domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: Nursing aspects of managing children on adult ICUs
description: An overview of things to consider when nursing children in ITU, organised in an A to E structure.
domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title: Management of the child requiring intensive care: an overview for adult practitioners

title: Discharging babies with bronchiolitis from the Emergency Department (DFTB)

This infographic from DFTB reminds of 
1. When we can discharge babies from the ED and 
2. Information we should be providing upon discharge

mapped_skills.objective: Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Discharge > Demonstrates when it is appropriate to discharge a patient, and provides the correct safety netting and advice to parents/ careres on discharge

title: Safety Netting for Bronchiolitis (DFTB)
description:
This blog from DFTB discusses bronchiolitis in the context of the three core components of safety netting:
1. If I am right, what do I expect to happen?
2. How will I know if I am wrong?
3. What would I do then?

mapped_skills.objective: Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Assessment and Recognition > Can describe high risk groups for poorer prognosis (Bronchiolitis)

Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Discharge > Demonstrates when it is appropriate to discharge a patient, and provides the correct safety netting and advice to parents/ careres on discharge

title: Preparing you, your colleagues and your unit for a bronchiolitis surge (RCEM)
description: A collection of suggestions from the Royal College of Emergency Medicine & Creative Commons (RCEM) based on Covid-19 and childhood respiratory illnesses to help prepare for a bronchiolitis surge, using some of the Australian data as an early warning.

Safety >  Standard and Transmission Based Infection Control Precautions (ICP) > Understands the ten Standard ICP measures to reduce risk of transmissions of infectious agents, including how to preform patient placement risk assessments e.g. cohorting and understanding local environment

domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title: High Flow Nasal Canula Oxygen Therapy, at a glance (DFTB)
description: This resource is a summary of evidence-based use of high flow nasal cannula. The infographic is a practical guide covering the basics to support clinicians in practice.

mapped_skills.objective: Breathing >  High flow therapy > Demonstrates the need for high flow therapy and the benefits of high flow/ high velocity therapy

Breathing >  High flow therapy > Demonstrates how to set up and use the high flow/high velocity circuit, including troubleshooting. Is able to provide continued care and can demonstrate when to wean and how to recongise the deterioriating patient on high flow/ high velocity therapy.

keywords: high flow nasal canula oxygen therapy

title: High Flow Help, a DFTB Blog
description: As cases of bronchiolitis increase in the wake of COVID the DFTB team visit some of the more pragmatic aspects of care. In this post, the use of high flow oxygen is reviewed.
keywords: high flow nasal canula oxygen therapy

title: High Flow Nasal Canula Oxygen: Good to know (DFTB)
description:
As we prepare for the respiratory surge, we need to think about how we are going to streamline our use of high flow. We need to be able to use it appropriately, consider alternatives, and know when to stop it. Kat Priddis takes us through it for DFTB in collaboration with Health Education England, Respiratory Surge in Children programme (https://tinyurl.com/respsurge).

0:00 Intro
0:55 Which babies need it?
2:12 How do we know when to start?
2:56 How do we start high flow?
3:07 What are our alternative options?
3:38 Who is going to fail high flow?
4:25 What happens when high flow fails?
5:28 When can we stop high flow?
7:07 What else can we do to prepare?

mapped_skills.objective: Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Assessment and Recognition > B - Explain immediate care of child with apnoea
Breathing >  High flow therapy > Demonstrates the need for high flow therapy and the benefits of high flow/ high velocity therapy
Breathing >  High flow therapy > Demonstrates how to correctly use PPE including donning and doffing process for aerosol generating procedures such as high flow/ high velocity therapy

Breathing >  High flow therapy > Demonstrates how to set up and use the high flow/high velocity circuit, including troubleshooting. Is able to provide continued care and can demonstrate when to wean and how to recongise the deterioriating patient on high flow/ high velocity therapy.
Breathing >  Non-invasive ventilation (CPAP, BiPAP) > Can explain the difference between NIV and CPAP, including indications, contraindications and mechanism of action

keywords: high flow nasal canula oxygen (hfnco) resource management

title: NICE Bronchiolitis in children: diagnosis and management. NICE guideline [NG9] updated August 2021
description: This guideline covers diagnosing and managing bronchiolitis in babies and children. It aims to help healthcare professionals diagnose bronchiolitis and identify if babies and children should be cared for at home or in hospital. It describes treatments and interventions that can be used to help with the symptoms of bronchiolitis.

domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: Staff Recovery Resources: Emotional and psychological support spaces for NHS staff.
description:
These resources have been created to support healthcare staff recovering from the COVID-19 pandemic. The resources have been curated by the London Transformation and Learning Collaborative. Not all people approach wellbeing by the same means. These resources acknowledge those differences and cover a variety of approaches, such as Wellbeing Conversations, Creative Story Telling workshops and a mini-series of filmed conversations with critical care workers starting with a discussion around Moral Injury. All the resources help health and care staff explore how they feel and how they might respond to those around them. 
Materials to support “Negotiating Brave Conversations” have now been added to this page as well so that these sessions can be facilitated within NHS Trusts/Integrated Care Systems.

title: Searchable Equipment Support Resource
description: This mobile friendly web app allows the user to rapidly access quick guides, manuals, and training videos for most of the equipment used to support children with severe respiratory illnesses and in critical care units (paediatric and adults). You can search by equipment purpose, make and model to find specific guides that are all free and open access. For example, High Flow / High Velocity Therapy: Armstrong:  AquaVENT FD140i or Syringe Pump: DeepMed: SP4. Please note, while these are the most accessible guides available, some may not be from manufacturers, and all should be viewed in the context of local trust or site practice.

title: Paediatric Respiratory Surge Cross Skilling Competency Document for Ward Based Staff
description: A downloadable resource to be used for cross skilling of staff on a ward based level including competencies in NG Tubes, Suctioning, Medicine Management and Heated Humidified High Flow Therapy

Airway >  Airway essential > Demonstrates suction clearance of oropharyngeal secretions including use of appropriately sized yankeur/suction catheter

Breathing >  High flow therapy > Demonstrates how to set up and use the high flow/high velocity circuit, including troubleshooting. Is able to provide continued care and can demonstrate when to wean and how to recongise the deterioriating patient on high flow/ high velocity therapy.

title: Managing bronchiolitis in adult ICUs - Part 2 (PCCS)
description:
Part 2 of a webinar series created by the Paediatric Critical Care Society (PCCS) for managing children with bronchiolitis on adult ICUs: 
- Introduction and Chair (Akash Deep/Ajay Desai, Chairs of the Science and Education Committee, PCCS UK) 
00:00-14:30: 
What should paediatricians learn from the adult surge and what would adult healthcare professionals want to learn to be prepared to treat children on their unit? 
Dr Phil Hopkins – Consultant Intensivist, King’s College Hospital, London

14:45-40:45 
Anaesthetic and medical management considerations in managing children on adult ICU 
Jo Perkins – Consultant Anaesthetist and Paediatric – Intensivist – Evelina London Children’s Hospital

41:00-57:20:
Nursing consideration to manage children on adult ICUs 
Sam Archer – Paediatric Development Nurse, King’s College Hospital, London

57:20 – 01:12:41
Nutrition focused assessment in children with RSV
Luise Marino – Clinical Academic Paediatric Dietician, Southampton Children’s Hospital

1:12:52 – 1:33:40 
Pharmacy considerations in children with bronchiolitis 
Andrew Wignell – Advanced Pharmacy Practitioner, Paediatric Critical Care, Nottingham Children’s Hospital

1:33:52-1:49:00 
Physiotherapy in children with bronchiolitis 
Simon Gates, Paediatric Physiotherapist, Paediatric Critical Care, Nottingham Children’s Hospital

1:49:00 – 1:57:53 (end) 
Panel Discussion
Moderated by Carli Whittaker, Vice Presider, PCCS

title: RSV surge background & PHE: PCCS Bronchiolitis Webinar 1.1
description: Dr James Fraser. RSV surge background - PHE modelling & the possible implications for paediatric services in the UK. This session was delivered as part of the main PCCS webinar 1.

title: Recognition & differentiation of the deteriorating child: PCCS Bronchiolitis Webinar 1.2
description: Dr Damien Roland. Recognition & differentiation of the deteriorating infant or child. Challenges, cautions & strategies for appropriate care. This session was a delivered as part of the main PCCS webinar 1.

mapped_skills.objective: Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Assessment and Recognition > Adopts an A-E approach to assessing a sick and deterioriating child
Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Assessment and Recognition > Can determine severity of child's condition (Bronchiolitis), including recognising concerning symptoms

domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title: Non-ventilatory management of the infant with bronchiolitis: PCCS Bronchiolitis Webinar 1.3
description: Professor Ian Moconochie. Management of RSV bronchiolitis according to the NICE guidance. General paediatrics & emergency care. This session was delivered as part of the main PCCS webinar. 1 .
domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: Non-invasive respiratory support - HFNC, CPAP & BiPAP: PCCS Bronchiolitis Webinar 1.4
description: Dr Padmanabhan Ramnarayan. Assessment of & decision-making for the infant or child who requires non-invasive respiratory support. Indications, cautions & consideration of the evidence base. Mild, moderate & severe disease. Hierarchy of therapies: low flow O2, HFNC, CPAP & BiPAP. This session was delivered as part of the main PCCS webinar 1.

mapped_skills.objective: Breathing >  High flow therapy > Explains how to escalate early if a patient on HF/HV (e.g. increasing oxygen requirement / increased respiratory effort)
Breathing >  Non-invasive ventilation (CPAP, BiPAP) > Can explain the difference between NIV and CPAP, including indications, contraindications and mechanism of action

title: Stabilisation of an infant or child prior to PICU transfer: PCCS Bronchiolitis Webinar 1.5
description: Jan Hervo - Lead ANP. Infants & children with bronchiolitis who require intubation, ventilation & transfer to PICU. ABC assessment, possible underlying diagnoses & appropriate management. Cautions & considerations for transport. This session was delivered as part of the main PCCS webinar 1.

Logistics, communications & flexibility during a changing clinical, national & global situation. This session was delivered as part of the main PCCS webinar 1.
domain: 4. Differences between child and adult and Medicines Management

description: A document to support the workforce redeployment planning for acute paediatric services, in response to the predicted earlier and greater than usual increase in RSV and respiratory illness in children (2021)

title: ETT taping - clinical context & safety
description: The clinical context for Melbourne Strapping (ETT taping with Elastoplast) is often complex & dynamic. This resource identifies the key aspects of planning, preparation & safety regarding ETT taping or re-taping. It highlights the importance of liaising with MDT experts & co-ordinators, preparing emergency equipment, patient monitoring & any necessary drugs. There is a stepwise, pictorial guide through Melbourne Strapping (oral & nasal) with practical tips for a high quality result.

mapped_skills.objective: Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Emergency Advanced stabilisation including intubation and ventilation > Can assist with intubation, including safely securing/taping the Endotracheal Tube either nasally or orally

title: High Flow Oxygen Therapy- Yorkshire and Humber PCC ODN
description: What is High Flow Oxygen Therapy? A narrated presentation covering how it works, when to start, flow and temperature, monitoring and documentation, nutrition and hydration, advantages and disadvantages,  potential complications and complex patients

title: PHE guidance on the health care needs of patients from Afghanistan
description: Government advice about the health care needs / considerations of displaced Afghan citizens, with a particular focus on prevalence of infectious diseases, monitoring and immunisation needs.  Links to further information are available.

title: CPAP Competency Document for Nursing Staff
description: A comprehensive competency document for staff caring for a child on CPAP.  Education around all aspects of CPAP care and skill acquisition will be required in order to support learning and competence.

title: CPAP Experienced User Competency Document
description: A competency document for staff that have previous experience in  caring for a child on CPAP.  Education around all aspects of tracheostomy care and skill acquisition will be required in order to support learning and competence.

title: Guidelines for Nutrition Support of Infants & Children with Respiratory Syncytial Virus (RSV) and others who are acutely unwell
description: This guideline provides practical advice to determine nutritional requirements and establish support

title: Staff paediatric tracheostomy competency (GOSH)
description: A comprehensive competency document for staff caring for children with a trachestomy.  Education around all aspects of tracheostomy care and skill acquisition will be required in order to support learning and competence.

title: PICU - Enteral nutrition to be commenced where  a dietetic review is not available
description: Algorithm to use to aid with feeding decision in PICU
domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: PHDU - Enteral nutrition to be commenced where  a dietetic review is not available
description: Algorithm to use to aid with feeding decision in PHDU
domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: Ward - Enteral nutrition to be commenced where  a dietetic review is not available
description: Algorithm to use to aid with feeding decision on the ward
domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: Airway Clearance using the cough assist (MI:E)
description: Presentation by Dr Michelle Chatwin discussion airway clearance using the cough assist

mapped_skills.objective: Breathing >  Additional therapy > If relevenat to role, can understand and use the Cough assist

domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: NICE Guideline: Intravenous fluid therapy in children & young people in hospital
description: This guideline covers the general principles for managing IV fluids for children and young people under 16yrs.
domain: 4. Differences between child and adult and Medicines Management

title: Fluid calculations (worked examples) for infants & children in hospital
description: Worked examples of fluid allowance calculations using the Holliday-Segar formula. These are based on the NICE guideline for IV fluid maintenance for Children & Young People in Hospital.
domain: 4. Differences between child and adult and Medicines Management

title: Basic Principles of Blood Gases and Interpretation of Results - Yorkshire and Humber PCC ODN
description: A video looking at the normal value range for blood gases and the interpretation of blood gases looking at: compensated or uncompensated, metabolic or respiratory and looking at the wider clinical picture

mapped_skills.objective:
Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Management and 
Escalation > Able to identify normal blood gas values (capillary, venous, arterial) dependent on level of care area e.g. capillary gas in GP practice

Recognition of deterioriation, management and escalation of care >  Management and 
Escalation > Interpret blood gas values and refer for escalation/intervention

domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title: Medicines Management and IV Fluid Calculations Workbook
description: A workbook and competency guide looking at medication management and IV fluid calculations

title: Nasogastric Tube Insertion and Management  Workbook
description: A workbook and competency guide looking at Nasogastric tube insertion and management

title: Clinical Guideline: Bronchiolitis diagnosis & management in secondary care (University Hospitals Bristol & Weston NHS Foundation Trust)
description: An example of a clinical guideline for the diagnosis and management of bronchiolitis in secondary care.  Includes an example flow chart for the management of mild, moderate and severe cases from admission through to discharge.  Demonstrates a step wise approach to management.
domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title: Clinical Guideline: Paediatric Oxygen Therapy (University Hospitals Bristol & Western NHS Foundation Trust)
description: An example of a clinical guideline to support the delivery of oxygen in paediatrics (both ED and inpatient wards) Gives a clear rationale for each delivery method.
domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: Clinical Guideline: Heated Humidified High Flow for Children & Young People. (PIER Network)
description: An example of a clinical guideline to support the delivery of high flow therapy to children and young people.  Gives clear information on flow rates, oxygen delivery, stabilisation and weaning.

title: Lung sounds made easy - ausculations
description: Youtube video discussing different sounds heard on ausculation with audio clips of added sounds
domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title: Videos: Respiratory Distress symptoms
description: Webpage with videos of different children with signs of respiratory distress
domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title: CPAP: Principles & Clinical Context
description: CPAP - indications, contraindications, key signs of respiratory failure & ABCDE respiratory asessment, principles of safety - sizing of nose pieces & ensuring gas flow, MDT collaboration.
domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: Welsh Language information Leaflet on RSV
description: Welsh Language information Leaflet on RSV

title: Anatomical and Physiological Differences between Paediatric and Adult Respiratory Systems
description: Webinar discussing the anatomical and physiological differences between children and adults from a physiotherapy perspective
domain: 4. Differences between child and adult and Medicines Management

title: RSV and other Viruses - Risk Factors and Impacts on the Paediatric Population
description: Webinar discussing what RSV and other virsus are and the signs and symptoms
domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title: The Intubated Infant with RSV/Bronchiolitis - a Physiotherapy Perspective
description: Webinar discussing the physiotherapy assessment and treatment of a child with bronchiolistis in PICU
domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: The Deteriorating Child with Complex Needs in the Community - a Physiotherapy Perspective
description: Webinar discussing the physiotherapy assessment and treatment of a deteriotating child with complex needs in the community
domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: Management of a Child/Baby with Bronchiolitis on the Ward - a Physiotherapy Perspective
description: Webinar discussing the physiotherapy assessment and treatment of a child with bronchiolistis on the ward
domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: Supportive Therapy for the RSV/Bronchiolitis Patient
description: Webinar discussing the use of adjuncts such as nasal high flow oxygen and CPAP with a child on the wards
domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: The Impact of  Respiratory Illness on Swallow Function in Children
description: Webinar discussing how infants swallow and why it becomes a problem when they have a respiratory infection
domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: Bronchiolitis: Parents Questions Answered- a Healthier Together Resource
description:
00:00 - intro
 00:30 - What is bronchiolitis? 
2:06 - What things should you look out for? 
5:50 - What are the "alarm signs" you should worry about? 
7:04 - How will bronchiolitis affect my baby's feeding? 
7:58 - What other things should concern you? 
8:46 - What will happen if your child needs to go to hospital?

title: Bronchiolitis Pathway: Management in the acute setting.
description: A flowchart for the clinical assessment and management of suspected brocniolitis in children under 1y presenting in the acute setting.
domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: Re-ACT Talks: Scores or Systems: What is a PEWS?
description: Scores or Systems: What is a PEWS? – By Damian Roland, Consultant and Honorary Senior Lecturer in Paediatric Emergency Medicine, University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust and Leicester University
domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

description:
Chair: Jo Crook, Speaker: Chloe Benn

Intro 
04.15- Introduction to paeds – what is different? 
10.24- Altered drug handling 
13.08- Drug history and reconciliation  
20.54- Is the prescription correct? 
24.54- Clinical Checks 
26.08- Choose a drug/formulation 
26.41- Drug Licencing 
27.22- Excipients 
28.28- Standardised strengths 
29.07- Manipulating formulations 
30.17- Optimising doses
31.46- TTOs on discharge 
32.48- IV medications and Medusa
34.26- BNFc
36.03- Dosing in obesity 
36.44- Renal Function 
39.04 Local Guidelines

description:
Chair: Andrew Wignell Speaker Jo Crook

Intro
04.04- RSV and Bronchiolitis
06.12- Bronchiolitis 2021
08.40- When to refer and escalate

14.13- Think Sepsis

title: Quick Guide for equipment: Rad - G with Temperature
domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title: North East Childrens Transport And Retrival Emergency Drug Preperation (NECTAR)
Masimo RAD-G Saturation monitor Quick Set-up Guide.
description: A pictoral guide to using the Masimo RAD-G Saturation monitor.
domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title: Boloh helpline poster for parents who are worried their child may have a chest infection. (Barnardo's)
description: A poster from Barnardo's with information about their Boloh helpline for families from black, asian & minority ethnic backgrounds.  Parents can access written advice in several different languages.

title: Barnardo's Boloh helpline card template.
description: Barnardo's have produced a card template that can be printed locally and given to families, directing them to their Boloh helpline for respiratory illness in children.

title: Paediatric IV Administration Guide Y - site Compatibility Chart
description: A Guide to which drugs can be ran together using the same IV infusion line (Y-Site compatability).
domain: 4. Differences between child and adult and Medicines Management

title: Paediatric Fluid balance Scenarios
description: A Q&A PowerPoint comprosed of 4 fluid balance scenarios in paediatrics  - routine IV fluid requirement, hypovolaemia, plmonary oedema & diuresis and DKA. Questions are posed, giving the reader an opportunity to consult the NICE guideline, identify the correct algorithm and consider the correct management. Responses are provided on subsequent slides.
domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: How to perform chest auscultation and interpret the findings
description: A comprehensive guide on how to ascultate and listen to chests from the Nursing Times
domain: 2. The care and management of the child with Respiratory Illness

title: APLS (2016) Paediatric Vital Signs Parameters. (Advanced Life Support Group)
description: A quick reference guide to the normal values for paediatric vital signs (birth to 14yrs), produced by the Avanced Life Support Group. (2016)
domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title: Simulation video - Physiotherapy assessment and treatment of a baby with RSV
description: Simulation video. We invite you to take notes throughout this simulation, pausing when necessary to reflect on decisions made by Colin, a physiotherapist, who has been called to assess the condition of a 12-week old baby called Jimmy.
domain: 1. Recognition, management and escalation: care of the sick child

title: PCCS Standards for the Care of Critically Ill Children (6th Edition) Paediatric Critical Care Society
description: A set of quality standards for the care and management of critically unwell children and their families. (Paediatric Critical Care Society, 2021)

title: Pre-work mindfulness exercise for healthcare workers: pledges to myself (Belfast Health and Social Care Trust)
description: A short mindfulness exercise for healthcare staff before the start of their shift or workday (Belfast Health and Social Care Trust, 2020)

title: Going home checklist: mindfullness exercise (Mind)
description: Going home checklist: mindfullness exercise (Mind)
